meta.name: description
meta.content: Capitol West Academy is a charter school in Milwaukee, WI, emphasizing rigorous academics and character development, for children in grades K4 through 8th.

body.class: home page-template page-template-page-home page-template-page-home-php page page-id-2

div.div: Rigorous academics and character development inspire lifelong learning.

div.h1: Hello from CWA to You and Yours.

p.span:
Dear CWA Family,
Greetings from your teachers and support staff. We are thinking of you, missing you and hoping you are staying well. We’ve been keeping our minds and bodies active and hope you are too.
Here’s a little something we put together so you can “see” us; we can’t wait to see you all too. Until then, make it a Lovely Day.

Yours in service,
Dr. Mora Anderson + your entire school family
Capitol West Academy is closed until further notice in adherence with the state mandate to help control the spread of coronavirus, which causes the COVID-19 infection.

Our focus is on helping students keep their minds and bodies active. Parents should have received links to free web resources via Classroom Dojo. Any families who are not yet connected to Classroom Dojo should do so as it is our primary tool for educational communications. Contact your student’s classroom teacher should you have questions.

Due to low interest from CWA families, breakfast and lunch are not being provided in the interim. Parents are encouraged to use Milwaukee Public Schools (MPS) meal service weekdays between 11 a.m. – 1 p.m.
COVID-19 Resources:
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Wisconsin Department of Health Services
Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction
World Health Organization

Capitol West Academy, a tuition-free public charter school, provides a safe, nurturing, educational environment where children, with the support of their families and community, learn and grow to be successful lifelong learners and productive citizens.
With a dual emphasis on academic greatness and character excellence, CWA ensure that scholars have the support they need to reach their potential today, in high school, and beyond.
